metadata.title: New Phytologist Supporting Information A novel glucuronosyltransferase has an unprecedented ability to catalyse continuous two-step glucuronosylation of glycyrrhetinic acid to yield glycyrrhizin

body_text.text: GU-root1, the root sample treated by salt; GU-root2, the root sample treated by drought; GU-root3, the control. FPKM represents reads per kilobase of exon model per million mapped reads.
GU-root1, the root sample treated by salt; GU-root2, the root sample treated by drought; GU-root3, the control.
body_text.section: Fig. S7 Pearson correlation analysis among samples.

body_text.text: GU-root1, the root sample that is treated with salt; GU-root2, the root sample that is treated with drought; and GU-root3, the control. GU-root1, the root sample treated by salt; GU-root2, the root sample treated by drought; GU-root3, the control. Amino acids with confidence coefficient>95% are highlighted by green background. The kinetic parameters are detected with glycyrrhetinic acid and glucopyranosiduronic acid as acceptors.
body_text.section: Fig. S8 Volcano plots of differentially expressed genes.

body_text.text: Amino acid sequences of these glycosyltransferase were aligned by ClustalW using MEGA 6.0. The output of result was used to create phylogenetic tree by MEGA 6.0 using Neighbor-Joining method, with Poisson correction as the model. The bootstrap confidence values were obtained based on 1000 replicates. GuUGAT was highlighted by red fonts. The triterpenoid glucosyltransferases are labeled with red subclades. The UGT73 family members are labeled with purple fonts. The UGT72 family members are labeled with cyan fonts. The UGT71 family members are labeled with green fonts. The UGT80 family members are labeled with springgreen fonts. The UGT75 family members are labeled with grey fonts. The UGT74 family members are labeled with blue fonts. The UGT84 family members are labeled with pink fonts. The UGT76 family members are labeled with brown fonts. Most sequences were collected from UniProtKB/Swiss-Prot database. Some triterpenoid glucosyltransferases not annotated in UniProtKB/Swiss-Prot database were supplemented from NCBI database. UniProtKB/Swiss-Prot or NCBI accession numbers are labeled in the end of subclades.
body_text.section: Fig. S18 Phylogenetic tree of characterized plant glycosyltransferases..

FIGREF1.text: S1 Quality assessment of total RNA used for deep transcriptome sequencing. 1, sample of control; 2, sample of salt treatment; 3, sample of drought treatment. (A) Roots from seedlings. (B) Electropherogram of total RNA. M, markers. Markers from top to down: 2000 bp, 1500 bp, 1000 bp, 750 bp, 500 bp, 250 bp, 100 bp. (C) Extracted RNAs determined by HPLC. (D) Summary sheet. RIN, RNA integrity number. 4 Fig. S2 Whole distribution of annotated unigenes 5 Fig. S3 Classification of annotated unigenes by gene function. 6 Fig. S4 KOG classification of annotated unigenes.

FIGREF2.text: . S5 KEGG classification of annotated unigenes. Uppercase letters given on the right-hand side of the figure indicate KEGG classification. A, Cellular Processes; B, Environmental Information Processing; C, Genetic Information Processing; D, Metabolism; E, Organismal Systems.

FIGREF3.text: Gene expression distribution among three RNA-Seq samples.

FIGREF4.text: Detailed hierarchical clustering and corresponding heatmaps of the unigenes across all of the pairwise library comparisons.

FIGREF5.text: Expression levels of 8 candidate UGTs, bAS and two CYPs. (A) Expression level of 8 candidate UGTs. (B) Relative activity (%) of 8 candidate UGTs.

FIGREF7.text: Analysis of the MS fragmentation pathway of the catalytic product.(a) MS and MS2 of catalytic product. (b) MS fragmentation pathway of the catalytic product. Characteristic fragment ion of "two coupled GlcA residues" is highlighted by red fonts.

FIGREF8.text: Catalytic specificity of GuUGAT towards UDP sugars.1 mM UDP-sugars of UDP-GlcA, UDP-galactose or UDP-glucose and 50 μM substrates of glycyrrhetinic acid or glucopyranosiduronic acid are incubated in the reactions.

FIGREF9.text: Expression pattern of GuUGAT based on real-time PCR. Fig. S16 Expression level of the GuUGAT gene and content of glycyrrhizin in roots under stress conditions.Significant difference (p<0.05) is indicated by asterisk (*) and highly significant difference (p<0.01) is indicated by asterisk (**). Error bars used in the figure indicate standard deviations (SDs).

FIGREF10.text: Determination of kinetic parameters for recombinant GuUGAT.

FIGREF11.text: . S19 Phylogenetic tree of characterized plant triterpenoid UGTs.Triterpenoid UGTs of UGT73 family are highlighted by red text. Triterpenoid UGTs of UGT71 family are highlighted by blue text. Triterpenoid UGTs of UGT74 family are highlighted by pink text. Triterpenoid UGTs of UGT91 family are highlighted by green text. Triterpenoid UGTs of UGT94 family are highlighted by brown text.
